item.description:
Please CHECK YOUR EMAIL OR THIS WEBSITE before coming up tomorrow night, I will update the website and send email if I find out we need to change locations or cancel due to weather/clouds. Thanks! 

I know this is last minute, but I've had a few people send me articles and express interest. Thanks for the heads up everyone. Hope you'll join us! 

The moon is set to rise tomorrow night at 7:15p.m, ESE at the horizon. 

Thanks to a fluke of orbital mechanics that brings the moon closer to Earth than that it has been in more than 18 years, the biggest full moon of 2011 will occur on Saturday, leading some observers to dub it a "supermoon." Read more HERE.

 

Where: Good Harbor Beach, Gloucester, MA at the Foot Bridge on Nautilus Road (around Beach St) (Good Harbor Beach Footbridge @42.617778,-70.636126)

Time: 6:00p.m. 

Parking: The parking lot for Good Harbor is closed. There is street parking on Bass Ave/Nautilus Road. 

How to Dress: Please wear comfortable shoes. We'll probably need to walk up the beach a ways, or we could even walk further down Atlantic Ave (no parking along there) to shoot from there. It's only supposed to be 29 degrees tomorrow night, dress warm! 

What to Bring: Tripod, remote shutter release.
item.why: On Saturday afternoon at 3 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time, the moon will arrive at its closest point to the Earth in 2011: a distance of 221,565 miles (356,575 kilometers) away. And only 50 minutes earlier, the moon will officially be full.
item.name: Super Moon Shoot
